intro: Parabignonia unguiculata, commonly known as African mahogany, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is noted for its durable, heavy wood that is highly valued in the timber industry. It also has medicinal uses, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Parabignonia unguiculata plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing habitat and food for a variety of wildlife.
